name: Sin City Cocktail Dip
description: Inspired by the home of shrimp cocktail--Las Vegas--this dip is a game day party in a bowl. Mix avocados, tomato and lime juice with McCormick® Guacamole Seasoning Mix. Garnish with extra cocktail sauce and enjoy with dippers like sliced baguette or crackers.
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) package McCormick® Guacamole Seasoning Mix
¾ cup small cooked shrimp, cut into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Mix avocados, tomatoes, lime juice and Seasoning Mix in medium bowl. Set aside.
Mix cream cheese and sour cream in small bowl. Spread in 9-inch glass pie plate. Drizzle with half of the cocktail sauce. Top with avocado mixture and shrimp. Drizzle with remaining cocktail sauce.
Serve with sliced baguette or crackers.

review.reviewBody: I LOVE avocados which is why I choose this recipe. However I also love shrimp... and I don't feel like it came out very well in this recipe! Maybe add more shrimp next time! The flavors absolutely remind me of Vegas. We served it with baguettes and fries... and liked the fries with it better! Very food-truck like! Good recipe thank you!

I was a little disappointed with this because I do so love all the ingredients! I used the tequila option but actually think that the lime juice would have been better. I had a difficult time telling the individual flavors because they all just seemed to run together. It is an interesting concept and if I have some shrimp left at some point I will try this again but with the lime. It was worth a try to make this one! Thanks McCormick!

I thought this was pretty great but I was in the minority. I think the popular consensus was that the sour cream/cream cheese layer needed some sort of seasoning added to it. As it was because of the avocado and the suspicion that it wouldn't keep very well we wound up throwing a lot of it away at the end of the night.

Hubby really liked it and rated it a 4! I think a 3. I was excited about the ingredients but I used the tequila and that definitely made a difference for me not liking it as much. It took away the fresh flavor. I added diced celery because I love a shrimp cocktail with celery and that was a good addition. I ll cut the dairy down by half and use only lime juice next time. I thought everyone would LOVE the shrimp dish as I was generous with the shrimp but it just wasn t the big hit. But will try it again with the changes and see what happens.

I chose this recipe because I love all the ingredients. I decided to use the lime juice instead of the Tequila based on what I read on previews reviews I also decided to add a little bit of red onion and cilantro as I thought these ingredients were going to enhance the flavor of the dip. The flavors are great but I give it 4 stars because in my opinion the amount of cheese and cream mix is far too much. We ate the dip with pita chips.I had never tried the McCormick guacamole seasoning and its really good. I will make this again and cut the cheese and cream in half.
